resources.string: NASA has added five missions to its orbiting Earth-observing fleet in 2014 - the biggest one-year increase in more than a decade.
Which of the following missions was launched in the year of 2014?
Cocoa grows best in shady, moist rain-forests which is why climate change and deforestation pose such a threat to chocolate supplies.
Which two countries are responsible for over 70% of the world\'s cocoa supply?
When you buy chocolate, be sure to support farmers and the environment by purchasing Rainforest Alliance Certified products.

In 2017, the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora (CITES) added new species to its protected list. This means that global trade of these species became restricted.
Which two species were added to the protected list?

Although the Food and Drug Administration has repeatedly stated that nontherapeutic use of antibiotics on livestock is unsafe, the US continues to allow these drugs to be used. Other countries have taken the threat more seriously.
In addition to the entire European Union, which of the following has banned growth-promoting antibiotics for livestock?

In 2005, Taiwan banned growth-promoting antibiotics and requires veterinary prescriptions to use antimicrobials for livestock. Taiwan accounts for approximately 2% of annual U.S. export sales of food animal products, primarily in beef and poultry. Learn more about the countries that have restricted antibiotic use on livestock here
"Population growth in our cities demands sustainable solutions for transportation, buildings and other infrastructure. One hundred years ago, 20% of the world population lived in an urban area.
"What will the percentage of urban population be by 2050?

According to the World Health Organization: One hundred years ago, 2 out of every 10 people lived in an urban area. By 1990, less than 40% of the global population lived in a city, but as of 2010, more than half of all people live in an urban area. By 2030, 6 out of every 10 people will live in a city, and by 2050, this proportion will increase to 7 out of 10 people.
Zero waste means all discarded materials are designed to become resources for others to use. San Francisco, a national leader in waste management, has set an ambitious zero waste goal for the city.
By what year is San Francisco planning to recycle and compost 100% of its trash?

From the San Francisco Department of the Environment: "The City and County of San Francisco believes achieving zero waste is possible. To achieve 100 percent zero waste, SF Environment will continue to advocate for state legislation and partner with producers to develop a producer responsibility system, where producers design better products and take responsibility for the entire life-cycle of a product, including take-back and recycling."

The Times Square New Year\'s Eve ball has come a long way from its first design in 1907. Originally comprised of 100 incandescent light bulbs, the modern ball is filled with a kaleidoscope of thousands of efficient LED lights. LED lightbulbs are 75% more efficient than standard incandescent bulbs and last a lot longer.
Up to how many years can an LED lightbulb last for?

The Ivanpah solar thermal plant in the Mohave Desert of California went online by the end of 2013. During construction, developers unexpectedly encountered nearly 200 of a particular threatened animal.
What animal was threatened by the construction of the solar thermal plant?

After finding more tortoises than anticipated, developers relocated them to a different site with the assistance of environmental organizations. The incident illustrated why careful siting is an important part of any kind of energy development.

Although the countries that comprise the Arctic nations have made policy statements underlining the importance of working together, the rapid melting now taking place in the Arctic, combined with increased militarization and tensions around resources, pose a challenge to its stability. Did you know that the U.S. is considered an Arctic nation because its territory extends into the region known as the Arctic Circle? Protecting this region will require the cooperation of every Arctic nation.
Test your knowledge: How many Arctic nations are there?

Norway, Sweden, Finland, Russia, the United States, Canada, Denmark (Greenland, and Iceland are all Arctic nations. In addition, many indigenous communities have lived in the region for thousands of years and they make up 10% of the population there. The film People of a Feather documents seven winters in the lives of one such community.

About 40% of trips in the U.S. are taken within 2 miles of home—an ideal distance for riding a bike—yet only a small fraction of people pedal to their destination. Why is this? One of the biggest factors preventing people from riding bikes is concern for safety. When governments build bike lanes and paths, more people feel comfortable riding a bike.
The growth in bike commuting in the past decade is a result of cities growing their bike-friendly infrastructure.By what percentage did bike commuting increase in the U.S. between 2000 and 2010?
You\'ve got %d out of 10 correct answers\n
